resources.string: We pride ourselves on conveying hard-to-discover styles, sizes and widths since we realize that each individual’s needs contrast. Regardless of whether you’re experiencing issues looking over our vast determination of different shoes or you have a straightforward inquiry, our client benefit group is prepared and willing to help.

Step 1: Trace Foot. Place a piece of paper on the ground. 

Step 2: Measure Length. Use a measuring tape, measure the outline from the back/central part of the heel to the end of the longest toe. 

Step 3: Measure Width. 

Step 4: Find your Perfect Fit.
